title: Weird stutter with high/normal FPS
body:
So, when i play with vsync everything is fine, game looks smooth blablabla... but the thing with Vsync is it inputs a mouse lag... which means that the mouse feels heavy and is kinda inaccurate. So when i turn off my Vsync... i have like 100-300 fps (300+ in the beginning of the match and around 180 150 while playing.) I cap the FPS to 144, since if the FPS are too high it creates a screen tearing. But for some reason the game looks really shitty. like... its not smooth it stutters etc etc... and it feels like im playing with 30 fps or lower instead of 140+ i also have a GSync monitor but it doesnt change anything for me... 

My Specs:
16GB RAM
Gsync Monitor 100hz (Notebook) (League doesnt display at 100hz tho, only when i enable borderless. In fullscreen it is 75hz)
Nvidia GTX 980M
i7-4720HQ

PLEAAAAAAAAASE help me... i dont want to continue playing with mouse lag.... T____T

replies.body:
Do you have G-Sync enabled when this happens? I've seen G-Sync cause issues for League and other similar games in the past, so you may want to *temporarily disable it* to determine if it's causing problems in this situation.

Let me know what you find!
